thread.title: Rogue Community College campuses evacuated after bomb threat, report of armed men
thread.title_full: Rogue Community College campuses evacuated after bomb threat, report of armed men | OregonLive.com

author: Rick Bella | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Rogue Community College campuses evacuated after bomb threat, report of armed men
text:
Rogue Community College has evacuated all of its campuses in Jackson and Josephine counties, following a bomb threat and an anonymous report of armed people on the grounds of the school's Grants Pass campus.
A college spokesman said officials received a threat around 10 a.m., targeting the college's Redwood campus , an 80-acre, wooded complex on the outskirts of Grants Pass. The college then activated its emergency-alert system, informing students and employees of the threat. The alert was followed by a message on Twitter, asking everyone to evacuate.
Shortly afterward, Rogue officials sent out an evacuation notice for the Riverside campus , which spans four blocks in downtown Medford, and for the Table Rock campus in White City.
All have been advised to take their backpacks, computers and cell phones and have been urged not to wait at transit stops adjacent to the campuses.
Oregon State Police have launched a criminal investigation, but no results or details have been released.
-- Rick Bella rbella@oregonian.com
503-294-5915; @southnewshound
